name: CSS File Selector
author: Christian Gil

sections.description: A simple WordPress plugin that allows users to select files CSS and/or write CSS rules to any single page or post
sections.installation:
This section describes how to install the plugin and get it working.

  1. Upload entire css-file-selector folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. That’s it, you’ll see a Select CSS files and/or write your custom CSS rules metabox on all add or edit posts/pages.
sections.changelog:
1.0.4

  • Solved a warning in debug mode.

1.0.3

  • Fixed a little error in the field select that showed the CSS files of the root path in the wrong folders. This little error did not prejudice the functionality of the plugin.

1.0.2

  • Modified the central file to better manage call functions and styles plugin
  • Modified javascript functions to better support older versions of jQuery

1.0.1

  • Fixed bug that emptied the options of select field when the button Preview Changes was pressed

1.0

  • Initial version
